thread.title: Patent war takes £560m bite out of Apple
thread.title_full: Patent war takes £560m bite out of Apple

title: Patent war takes £560m bite out of Apple
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Patent war takes £560m bite out of Apple Apple is no stranger to courtroom battles Sergei Bobylev/ITAR-TASS Photo/Corbis James Dean Technology Correspondent Published at 12:01AM, October 15 2015 
Apple faces a £560 million legal bill after coming under fire in the technology industry’s relentless patent wars. 
A jury in the United States decided that microchips used in some of Apple’s iPhones infringed a patent. According to a recent ruling by the judge in the case, Apple could be forced to pay as much as $862 million damages. 
The court in Madison, Wisconsin, found that Apple had used patented technology that improved chip efficiency without the permission of its owner, the licensing arm of the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation. 
The court has yet to determine exactly how much Apple Subscribe now
